text: Sander Martin "Sandy" Levin (born September 6, 1931) is an American politician. Heserved in the United States House of Representatives from 1983 to 2019, representing . Levin, a member of the Democratic Party from Michigan. He was the former ranking member on the House Ways and Means Committee; he was Chairman of the Ways and Means Committee from 2010 to 2011. His brother, Carl Levin, was the United States Senator from Michigan until retiring 2015. Levin ran for Governor of Michigan twice, in 1970 and 1974, both times loosing to William Milliken. In December 2017, Levin announced that he would retire from Congress at the end of his current term, and not seek re-election in 2018. ==References== ==Other websites== *Congressman Sandy Levin official U.S. House site *Campaign website * * Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Michigan Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Detroit Category:20th- century American politicians Category:21st-century American politicians
title: Sander Levin
